meanings.definition: To defeat or overcome with superior strength or force.
meanings.sent1: The superhero used his incredible strength to overpower the villain.
meanings.sent2: The army was able to overpower the enemy with their advanced weapons.
meanings.sent3: The tiny ant managed to overpower the big beetle in a surprising turn of events.
meanings.sent4: The storm's fierce winds seemed to overpower everything in their path.
meanings.sent5: The loud music can easily overpower the sound of the rain outside.

meanings.definition: To have a strong effect on someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The delicious smell of fresh cookies can overpower your senses.
meanings.sent2: The emotional speech seemed to overpower the audience, bringing many to tears.
meanings.sent3: The bright colors of the painting seemed to overpower the room, making it feel alive.
meanings.sent4: The strong perfume can overpower the entire elevator with its scent.
meanings.sent5: The excitement of the crowd can overpower even the most reserved person.
